title: Supporting Information Incorporating uracil and 5-halouracils into short peptide nucleic acids for enhanced recognition of A-U pairs in dsRNAs
body:
Compounds (1-5) were synthesized following the reported procedure and their 1 H NMR spectra were found to be identical as those reported (1-3).

General procedure for the synthesis of compounds 11-15: Compound 6-10 (500 mg) was dissolved in THF (10 mL) and stirred in an ice bath. Aqueous LiOH (1 M, 1 mL) was added dropwise and the reaction mixture was allowed to stir at room temperature for 0.5 h. Additional aqueous LiOH was added if the TLC analysis showed the presence of the unreacted ester. Upon completion of the reaction, THF was evaporated using a rotary evaporator. The reaction mixture was then acidified by aqueous HCl (1 M) in an ice bath until the pH reaches 2-3. The obtained precipitate was filtered by a Büchner funnel, washed with cold water and stored under vacuum in a desiccator. In the case where no precipitate was formed during acidification, the reaction mixture was extracted by 5% MeOH in DCM. The removal of organic solvents under reduced pressure yielded the respective product as a foamy solid.
